answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a few links which may be helpful.
You can review the web content policy for Fairfax County, VA below.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/15010
I found the City Website Technology Protocol page for St. Louis Missouri.
http://stlouis-mo.gov/government/departments/information-technology/web-development/website-technology-protocol.cfm
The state of Vermont uses an over arching Change Control Policy for IT which you can see below.
http://dii.vermont.gov/sites/dii/files/pdfs/Change-Control-Policy.pdf
Below I have included the webpage development guide for the Community College of San Francisco.
http://www.ccsf.edu/Policy/guidelines.html#approval
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Tracy Miller
text:
The City of Delray Beach is interested in hearing from other governments who have established a formal approval process for web site updates of city/county web sites.  Please provide any policies you may have that discuss this here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org. Thank you.  
Best Regards,  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation
title: Approval Process for Web Content
